page.title: 01Introduction,Block 03440126
page.content: This area contrasts greatly with the flat land of the Somerset Levels which lie to its north and south.The gently undulating landscape supports numerous farms.Fields are small and are used for grazing land and the cultivation of crops,mainly cereals.The population is well scattered,but one village dominates this area.Pitney has many old thatched cottages and farmhouses,built of the local blue lias.In recent years many new detatched houses and bungalows have been built in vacant plots within Pitney,along the A372 at Pibsbury,Upton and the western outskirts of Somerton.The area has two major roads:the B3153 in the north,the A372 in the south and in between runs the main line railway from Castle Cary to Taunton.All three follow a general east_west course across the block.
